website_summaries.verdict: Engineered to fit on a screw gun and ready for buffing action.
pros: Attaches to a cordless drill and within seconds you'll be on your way to buffing perfection
Noted to reduce stress when it comes to professional detailing
Works great for general use and even for removing paint transfer
cons: Follow cleaning instructions carefully or the buffers may wear out

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use buffer & attachments
customer_reviews.text: Works great and got at a nice price. Use with my cordless drill and Mother's headlight restorer and it works wonders. Photo shows the left headlight that was completed using the orange buffer sponge. Right headlight was not done.
customer_reviews.author: M. Chung

customer_reviews.title: Not bad for $11!
customer_reviews.text: Not bad for $11! I bought this kit and some No.7 rubbing compound to remove some scuffs and a little paint transfer from the right rear fender of my Kia (my wife backed into it) and from the rear bumper of her car. The drill attachment is pretty stout, very decent quality, the velcro sticks great, and even though it came with an assortment of 7 foam pads, I only used one of the foam pads to take out the scuffing and transferred paint from both vehicles and then the woolen buffer pad to shine and clean it all. Worked like a champ, both vehicles look 100% better!
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Needs to be in your car care toolbox.
customer_reviews.text: I'm feeling pretty stupid that I didn't pick up this type of set years ago. I love my Dewalt variable speed polisher... but the 6"-8" buffing pads are an issue in tight fit areas and edges... these 3" pads compliments those larger pads very well and makes polishing out a new paint job much less stressful. If there is a knock to be had, I wish the backing pad was slightly undersized to minimize the possibility catching the edge as you reach into crevices... but it's something that I could probably trim down myself.
customer_reviews.author: widget

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely amazing. I don't know how I have done DIY jobs without these. They are extremely versatile and I plan on getting more. I used these to restore my car headlights, that were so hazy you couldn't even see inside, and now they look brand new. I also repainted my car hood and bumper with rattle cans myself and after wet sanding the clear coat for a few hours, I used these with an auto polish and they shine like a pro job. I am a woodworker and will absolutely continue to use these to help wax and polish finished products now that I know about them!
customer_reviews.author: Geoffrey Kennedy

customer_reviews.title: Check box contents.
customer_reviews.text: You call it a "drill adapter" and it's supposed to be included (the threaded metal piece with a 3/8-16 thread on one end, a shoulder in the middle and a 1/4 " shank on the other, to mount in the drill, I included that info. for anyone who got stiffed like I did and you know what to ask for at the hardware store). When this is missing the whole package is entirely useless. For me...it just cost some time because I'm a machinist and made one, but the other folks who get them this way, are out of luck and can't use it. Otherwise a great product for the price and a great convenience.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy A. Yorgan

customer_reviews.title: Useful but the Foam Tears Away from the Backing
customer_reviews.text: Given the price point of this product package of foam pads, I'd probably buy them again. But they are definitely not as durable as other major branded pads I have purchased from outlets that specialize in automotive detailing supplies. The hook-and-loop backing as well as the foam itself is more easily torn than on higher quality pads. The hook-and-loop backing of some of my pads appears to have debonded without tearing of the foam itself. Yet I found this kit useful for spot polishing using a drill motor.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Buyer Beware
customer_reviews.text: Where to start, first, no instructions, none, second NOT a proper drill bit, third that wouldn't matter because they connect via VELCRO (well that's an insult to velcro, it's whatever the Chinese version is). Hey have you been detailing exteriors of collectable cars your whole life like me? No? have fun when the not velcro or not drill bit comes flying off and you put your drill into your paint of your first nice car with all your muscle! Should be banned!!!
customer_reviews.author: Michelle L. Bradley

customer_reviews.title: Useful size for a variety of tasks.
customer_reviews.text: So far they are very useful. It's nice to get a set that is smaller. I might get a set of hook n loop backed pads for shoe shining. With a little patience these have proven useful for scrubbing off soap scum from shower and shower curtain. So far the pads have held together and worming well. Good variety of densities and a good price for the pack. I would (likely I will) buy again.
customer_reviews.author: BenK1976

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Headlights
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for headlights. I love that this kit came with multiple pads of the same type of foam. I had to trim the backing plate because it was overhanging the pad a bit. Simple scissor cutting around the pad works well, or a razor blade would work too. Pad seem pretty well made, not the highest quality, or QC control, but they definitely aren't terrible for headlight uses. I would buy again when they eventually need replacing.
customer_reviews.author: Tommy G.

customer_reviews.title: Didn't expect much, got something.
customer_reviews.text: I got this as an amateur car enthusiast to avoid paying hundreds of dollars for professional equipment. For less than $10, I didn't expect much from the product. But after using the different mats and the drill bit, it worked surprisingly well! As someone who has never used anything like this before though, I sort of wish it had some reference as to each pad, but I have no regrets with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Brian Cruz

customer_reviews.title: Bang for the buck.
customer_reviews.text: I'll keep this one short. This is a great too to have for a cordless drill and for anyone who wants to do some spot polishing with the provided pads or, which is what I bought this for, cordless headlight restoration using wheel polish. Does a great job keeping my polishing pads spinning and pegged in place while I work. Worth the purchase and if I need to get another one, I'll definitely buy one again!
customer_reviews.author: Jose I. Rodriguez-cruz

customer_reviews.title: Get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: Very cheap, low quality product. I used the foam wheels to try and polish some Plexiglas they ended up scratching it rather than polishing it, they also heated up and started to fall apart. The buffing wheel barely had any substance to it, it was made of some-kind of fake fur, I swear it started to melt when I tried polishing with it .
customer_reviews.author: Crazy Canuck

customer_reviews.title: Versatile
customer_reviews.text: These pads are a good size for tackling modestly sized details on your vehicle, such as headlights. They are inexpensive enough that I don’t mind using them around the house as well, with various rubbing compounds. Makes quick work of polishing things like brass handles and knobs with some barkeepers friend. Since the backing is velcro, they can be used wet or dry. I also plan to use on some the the iron detail on my wood stove with some Rutland polish. Quite a versatile set.
customer_reviews.author: Eagle

customer_reviews.title: Incomplete Kit
customer_reviews.text: Various Sponges good variety of stiffness for polishing. The problem was that the Kit was missing the threaded adapter to attach to the Pad which holds the various polishing & buffing pads. I had another Pad which the items from this Kit would attach to. Other wise the purchase would have been useless or I would have had to go through the aggravation of dealing with Customer Service to obtain the Threaded Adapter (which is pictured with the Kit) if it's even available separately. Too bad, nice Kit for polishing if it was complete at a nice price.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Bailey

customer_reviews.title: Very impressed with the durability, cost and effectiveness.
customer_reviews.text: These are a nice set of buffing sponges. My husbands uses these to buff the car after he waxes. After many time using them, they are lasting well. They no longer look bright and shiny but used and in good shape. They are well made as they have stood up to his use. They leave a nice shine, and not just one of them but a few. As he says they all have there purpose. As long as my car is pretty and my husband loves them it was worth every cent!
customer_reviews.author: Hope❤️

customer_reviews.title: A must have
customer_reviews.text: Definitely a must have for any car detailer or any car enthusiast. Very easy to use and easy attach to any corded or cordless drill. Makes detailing headlights and small areas very quick and manageable. Have used these about 9 times thus far as I do car detailing and headlight restoration periodically for family and friends on the side. These pads have not let me down yet. Will definitely order more.
customer_reviews.author: marc fraser

customer_reviews.title: No real grading of the colors like 1-4 you just have to feel and compare
customer_reviews.text: They worked. Each color has a different softness. No real grading of the colors like 1-4 you just have to feel and compare.The screw on pad doesn't have a simple lock or latch.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: No Information Provided
customer_reviews.text: Well made and function well, but there is no information about which color is for which purpose. Smaller size is perfect for polishing painted motorcycle panels and gas tank. Also spot-polished out some small scuffs on a car bumper and fender.
customer_reviews.author: T. Davis

customer_reviews.title: It was perfect for the final polishing and I plan to use ...
customer_reviews.text: Got this kit to restore my plastic headlights on my 2011 Kia Sorento with some headlight polish I bought at the auto parts store. It was perfect for the final polishing and I plan to use it for many other things. Good quality and I can see that these will hold up for a good number of projects before they deteriorate. Good strong velcro mount. Great kit for the money!
customer_reviews.author: B. Wells

customer_reviews.title: So many options So handy
customer_reviews.text: The Fontic 11pcs 3"/80mm Compound Drill Buffing Sponge Pads Kit is just what I needed. I purchased this product to finish buffing the edges of acrylic panels used for edge-lit signs. The kit contains several pads of different configurations that will work for wide variety of applications. Well worth the money spent.
customer_reviews.author: Dave R.

customer_reviews.title: Buy with caution!
customer_reviews.text: This is ok. Getting 3 stars since the pads fit very tight and on the small side, leaving the rough part of the velcro exposed to scratch your Paint.
customer_reviews.author: PriSil

customer_reviews.title: good price
customer_reviews.text: what i wanted use to clean headlight housing and small blemishes on vehicles. . , , , , , ,
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this item because someone hit my black/gray car with a blue shopping cart. Scratches pretty bad, got some turtle wax and some dawn soap and hot water. Washed the area put some wax on the flat orange pad. Buffed right out. Have no clue there was a scratch there ever!
customer_reviews.author: Connor

customer_reviews.title: Love These
customer_reviews.text: I love these! I use them on my cars, on my glass top stove, my stainless steel appliances and my granite countertops. If you need something polished, these will do the trick.
customer_reviews.author: RN

customer_reviews.title: Great kit for the money...not for every day use!
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent kit for the price. Parts stores sell these for easily 3 times as much! Read the description if your wondering what color pad is used for different polishing applications. The woll pad is kinda chincy, but still works. The entire kit is good for the DIY. Dont expect to use these every day and expect them to last.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what i was looking for.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this so i could buff out an old light fixture that has been in my family for many years. it worked perfectly, i just used these with a standard drill and they do exactly what they are supposed to. Now that I have them, i have buffed and polished anything i can find in the apartment lol.
customer_reviews.author: Lou

customer_reviews.title: ... more expensive buffing pad and so far I am pleased. You have to feel the foam to figure ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to see how they compared to more expensive buffing pad and so far I am pleased. You have to feel the foam to figure out which ones are more or less aggressive as they are not marked but that's no big deal. I have only used them a small amount so far and can tell they won't last as long as their more expensive competitors but for $10 they are well worth it in my book. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: SabaII

customer_reviews.title: Good starter set, just don't expect long-term quality
customer_reviews.text: This is a good starter set since it gives you a variety of different pass along with the backing plate and drill adapter. I used the orange pad to restore my headlights since it is the stiffest color included. However, the pad breaks down quickly, makes a mess. Nevertheless, it got the job done. I would buy it again
customer_reviews.author: J B

customer_reviews.title: Did the job and liked the price.
customer_reviews.text: Got me through one full paint job, which is what I needed. Could use them again. They do hold up well if you don't catch any sharp edges while using them. Hook & loop holds well. Good price for what you get.
customer_reviews.author: PCMirage

customer_reviews.title: Great automotive paint finishing tool set to repair minor scratches on your cars finish!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great automotive polishing tool set. I’ve already used it several times to polish out scratches in the clear coat on my wife’s car. For the price, it’s a super polishing set to remove scratches in a cars finish. It’s also easy to use with an electric or battery-powered drill!
customer_reviews.author: Rickster

customer_reviews.title: It's what you'd expect
customer_reviews.text: I thought this would be a great idea, but in the end I bought a dedicated $20 buffer that has a much larger surface area. This was useful for dealing with a couple straight line scratches, but it just made me want a bigger system so I could do the whole car. If you intend to use this for a specifically small area then that makes sense, but otherwise just get the bigger corded products.
customer_reviews.author: Seij

customer_reviews.title: They do the job and will fit your Ikea drill
customer_reviews.text: Fits on my cheap little IKEA drill great. Got for buffing scratches out of my car, will keep handy for future projects. Kinda wish it came with some kind of case, but overall not a bad product!
customer_reviews.author: Tori Sullivan

customer_reviews.title: I mostly did recommend it for headlights and small surfaces
customer_reviews.text: This package has what you need to work on small areas. I mostly did recommend it for headlights and small surfaces. If you're planning on doing your whole car or just your hood, make sure you have doing arms and time. For those types of jobs I'd recommend 5"-7".
customer_reviews.author: agustin

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done.
customer_reviews.text: Overall this product is very nice. It does everything that you would need it to do. I used this to clear up oxidation on my headlights. I used it in combination with Mothers PowerPlastic 4Lights. You can tell the foam heads are little on the lower side of quality, as the head that i used for my headlights has ripped.
customer_reviews.author: dangermouse

customer_reviews.title: Bargain pads
customer_reviews.text: I got my money's worth the day these arrived. I used two of the pads with MacGuier's polishes to restore my headlights, and remove paint transfer and some minor scratches from my car's body.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Bloom

customer_reviews.title: Save Your Money
customer_reviews.text: A guide or color chart to each pad/sponge Course or Order would have been nice. This product was garbage. Save your money.
customer_reviews.author: Manny

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: Mixed bag in terms of quality. Wool pads look cheap and reluctant to use it on,my machine. Other pads ok but not professional grade to last long. Still good value.
customer_reviews.author: Milton Cornell Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: Great for cleaning headlights, with a drill. Just add rubbing compound, takes less than 45 seconds, each headlamp.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Malkowski

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product
customer_reviews.text: Works well for a DIY detailing kit. Since I do not have a buffing machine; I've improvised by using an electric drill (alternating between slow and medium speed) to buff and wax my car. Great product and easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: P K

customer_reviews.title: Pretty nice for the price
customer_reviews.text: Pretty neat kit considering the price. Pads have been used several times and they are holding up pretty well. They are easy to wash as well. They are used along with a DA polisher.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for removing fog on car headlights
customer_reviews.text: I didn't use the arbor for an electric drill, I used the pads on a 3" buffer and it worked great. I'm sure they would work as good with an electric drill. I just ordered another set.
customer_reviews.author: John Danley

customer_reviews.title: Practical and great for the price
customer_reviews.text: 100% Recommended, I have used these to polish my car's headlights and it stayed in place and seem durable. So far so good.
customer_reviews.author: Elvis Aref Quintero

customer_reviews.title: Shiny car now
customer_reviews.text: Used clay bar first on paint blemishes. Then cut with compound buffer pads . hand waxed after that . pads were perfect .
customer_reviews.author: dean fluss

customer_reviews.title: buffing acrylic
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to use with Novus for my 300 gallon acrylic tank. Together they worked wonders.
customer_reviews.author: Tuesday

customer_reviews.title: fantastic value and quality
customer_reviews.text: these are really useful. I use them to restore plastic and acrylic furniture. They have been washed and reused multiple times and used for hours at a time. They held up great. I defenently would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Hm

customer_reviews.title: detailing pads
customer_reviews.text: this is a good auto detailing set the small 3 inch pads are perfect for tight places where a full size buffer can't fit the backing plate is sturdy the pads are firm medium and soft a good selection
customer_reviews.author: Shade tree

customer_reviews.title: GREAT FOR SHOE/BOOT POLISHING!
customer_reviews.text: Weird tagline right...? I was looking around for economical ways to efficiently shine my boots for work, and this product was the answer! I can't speak on the intended purpose for vehicular cosmetic maintenance, but if you're a weirdo like me looking to be efficient for shoe shining then this is the product for you.
customer_reviews.author: Dominick Lazaro

customer_reviews.title: Glass polishing
customer_reviews.text: I use it to polish off the water spots on my windshields. These work well. Would recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Ar

customer_reviews.title: Nice product
customer_reviews.text: I use these on motorcycles and they seem to hold up fine. The foam is at least as good as any other foam pad I’ve used.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Obrien

customer_reviews.title: a must have for diy!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This product is awesome!! I was skeptical because it was so inexpensive but wow..great for headlight restoration and for me removing small scratches without lugging the bigger tools around..I'm buying another..
customer_reviews.author: Jaime

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product for the money
customer_reviews.text: This work fantastic for my detailing needs and I would highly recommend them
customer_reviews.author: tony c.

customer_reviews.title: great product
customer_reviews.text: general use item nothing special just work and great price
customer_reviews.author: Carlo C.

customer_reviews.title: Good in a pinch
customer_reviews.text: Used these for some quick jobs and they work well. I haven't had any issues with the pads but it is a bit awkward using a drill to polish.
customer_reviews.author: HD

customer_reviews.title: This kit worked good. Foam pads tore up a little too easy
customer_reviews.text: This kit worked good. Foam pads tore up a little too easy . . . but part of that was me. for the money they did the job.
customer_reviews.author: Darrell M.

customer_reviews.title: lacking basic info
customer_reviews.text: No info provided with kit. Had to look it up in the order and dig around to find the levels of abrasiveness for each color
customer_reviews.author: joe goeke

customer_reviews.title: great for the smaller places that bigger pads can do
customer_reviews.text: Pros: great for the smaller places that bigger pads can do. The main unit the screw and Velcro backing pad hold up good. Cons: find that the pads disintegrate rather quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Hudson

customer_reviews.title: Works as designed
customer_reviews.text: I purchase this for clean my lamps by my own. And Done the work as i expected. Just remember purchase a good polish product.
customer_reviews.author: Cesar Solis

customer_reviews.title: They look fine just smaller then expected.
customer_reviews.text: We’re much smaller then they appeared in picture, maybe I didn’t read the measurements of them but they still worked although I haven’t used the wool pad yet, it looks much thinner the the picture but I got them to clean and wax my bathtub with so I think they will work fine. Makes it a lot easier to clean tub for an older person.
customer_reviews.author: Patti Page-Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Did its job.
customer_reviews.text: Some of the sponges edge fell apart while buffing my rims, but still got it done.
customer_reviews.author: Kailoha

customer_reviews.title: Careful as they will burn paint
customer_reviews.text: Other pads i have uses will not burn paint. These do if used at to high of a buffer speed.
customer_reviews.author: BSchr

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: Very cheap pads and backing. Half of the pads don’t even stick onto the backing. They are made for a onetime use. I will go with buff n shine or carpro 2 inch pads next time.
customer_reviews.author: Moises

customer_reviews.title: Color doesn’t matter I guess
customer_reviews.text: Get a bag full of different colored sponges with no directions on what each one is for
customer_reviews.author: Rendo

customer_reviews.title: Handy Drill Assortment
customer_reviews.text: Works with most any drill. Great variety of pads. I use it for shoe and car polish buffing using a cordless, variable speed drill.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: it would be a nice touch if the pads were labeled as to what ...
customer_reviews.text: The pads work well. However, it would be a nice touch if the pads were labeled as to what each pad should be used for, like orange being for heavy cut, yellow light cut, ect.
customer_reviews.author: Michael S.

customer_reviews.title: Does the trick
customer_reviews.text: I used with NOVUS to remove scratches from an acrylic aquarium. Time-consuming but worked.
customer_reviews.author: Bristle Nose

customer_reviews.title: great variety at affordable price
customer_reviews.text: great little set for terrific price. perfect for curves that the big pads can't get into
customer_reviews.author: Jimazon

customer_reviews.title: Foam sponges differ only in density which means the less ...
customer_reviews.text: Foam sponges differ only in density which means the less dense the less workable. Purchased to buff out fiberglass on boat. Wont buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Really!

customer_reviews.title: I had to reorder the goods as Amazon thought I ...
customer_reviews.text: I had to reorder the goods as Amazon thought I had returned the order which was not the case. I was advised to reorder which I did and of course this delayed the receipt about 4 weeks. The goods were as advertised and as I expected.
customer_reviews.author: Vicki

customer_reviews.title: Works well with Novus polishing compound.
customer_reviews.text: Nicely constructed kit. I use with Novus 3-2-1 plastic polish kit. Works Great.
customer_reviews.author: DCJDINMN

customer_reviews.title: I liked everything about this except that the Velcro that holds ...
customer_reviews.text: I liked everything about this except that the Velcro that holds the applicator(s) became separated from the drill pad after only two cars, rendering the item useless at this point. It worked pretty good on polishing the flat areas of the rims.
customer_reviews.author: Christian L. Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Amazing little pads! Worth it!
customer_reviews.text: It does the job! It took less than a few mintues to get the magical results! Cheeeep too!
customer_reviews.author: SKPROD T-shirts

customer_reviews.title: Good product!
customer_reviews.text: Product is exactly as described. Pads Velcro stick well unlike others. Plenty of pad options to choose from. Used to do a quick restore of vehicles oxidized headlights with standard household drill.
customer_reviews.author: KELLEY GALAN

customer_reviews.title: Great kit!
customer_reviews.text: Used this along with the Novus kit to attend to my yellowed headlights. This worked very well on my cordless drill. Different firmnesses included in this kit, which is good to have.
customer_reviews.author: Juan

customer_reviews.title: Don't use for polishing scratched
customer_reviews.text: I go this as a cheaper option to try to buff out some scratches in my car, I noticed that instead of breaking down the compound it just absorbed it, then once I turned up the speed on the drill it flung it out in chunks. And its not the compound, I know that for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Pacman836

customer_reviews.title: Work well
customer_reviews.text: These are a little small but they worked well on my headlights and my golf cart windshield.
customer_reviews.author: David S.

customer_reviews.title: Fit drill nicely
customer_reviews.text: I bought for particular project, it did okay but did sling polishing product around a few feet.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. Humphreys

customer_reviews.title: Great product and was able to use on my wife's ...
customer_reviews.text: Great product and was able to use on my wife's headlights with some cleaner. Now she can see driving at night. Cleaned up the headlight lenses.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: The pads hold up great especially the wool but the backing plate is uneven. Still recommend especially for the price
customer_reviews.author: Victor

customer_reviews.title: Sufficient
customer_reviews.text: Ther's really nothing to hate about these. Products match description and even professional standards in terms of color and density.
customer_reviews.author: Kelvin

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I have been well and I am writing very well.
customer_reviews.author: Kimjaehwan

customer_reviews.title: Not so great
customer_reviews.text: I used this once and the pads already ripped however it got the job done. Just not the quality I expected.
customer_reviews.author: Elvis

customer_reviews.title: Good Option
customer_reviews.text: Small but very good. Easily fits in smaller crevices larger pads cant. For the low price, its great for a fast polish.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah+Anthony

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: worth the price since I used them for more than four times.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: ... the base piece that attaches to the drill because useless after first use
customer_reviews.text: Velcro of the base piece that attaches to the drill because useless after first use. :(
customer_reviews.author: WL

customer_reviews.title: Good Product for price!
customer_reviews.text: Worked great. They are kinda small so it takes a while to wax a full size truck. Seem pretty durable. Form hasn't broken down yet!
customer_reviews.author: Melinda Delaney

customer_reviews.title: exceeded my expectations
customer_reviews.text: exceeded my expectations. quick attach to my drill add some compound and got rid of scratches that only got worse when I tried by hand. they are gone now!
customer_reviews.author: Don S.

customer_reviews.title: Not bad.
customer_reviews.text: Decent product. Won't last long at this price point, but for the need, this product performed just fine.
customer_reviews.author: TT

customer_reviews.title: the foam falls apart easily expecially if you snag it on something
customer_reviews.text: Pros: cheap Cons: the foam falls apart easily expecially if you snag it on something.
customer_reviews.author: Creativename

customer_reviews.title: Good quality. Used with a plastic polish on headlights
customer_reviews.text: As advertised. Good quality. Used with a plastic polish on headlights. No sanding required and turned out excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Callawaystu

customer_reviews.title: Good size for Golf Cart
customer_reviews.text: Great little buffer sponges to use on Golf Cart for buffing out scratches.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Good quality and works well
customer_reviews.text: Good quality and works well. Lost one star for no directions or guide to what each color is for. Had to go back to Amazon listing
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Most used to restore headlights with mother aluminum and polish. But have use to polish other objects
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Okay
customer_reviews.text: The buffer could have been thicker. The side of the grip hits the surface one might be polishing.
customer_reviews.author: WorkingTowardsBetter

customer_reviews.title: This worked fantastic to restore the windscreen on my motorcycle and happy ...
customer_reviews.text: This worked fantastic to restore the windscreen on my motorcycle and happy with the quality of the product. Need the right polish to get good results and this is the tool to make it happen.
